So yeah, at least it’s not fractured. To be honest I kinda already knew ballet had done some strange things to my toes and feet, but in a way it’s good to have that confirmed. Just need to ice the foot, get arch support insoles and wear supportive shoes.

Was at the doc’s today, told her my left foot’s been sore for a few weeks. She had a look, said I was flat-footed, which I was not when I was a kid. Then she said I had very strangely shaped ankles. I told her I did a lot of ballet when I was younger, she was like https://t.co/l8IOr1v1qN

@KLM Please get in touch with @PriscillaOno and help her find her luggage as soon as possible. You losing her bags could mean her losing part of her livelihood, equipment she has spent many years and a lot of money amassing as she built her career. Some of it irreplaceable.
@sarahhollowell You absolute beauty, you!

Had some wonderful times with my mum, dad, sister, brother-in-law and my ex-step-mum (it’s complicated lol) and her boyfriend. Just a wonderful holiday with the worst ending possible. Anyway, I’ll stop now cos I’m so hungry I could eat a vegetarian horse. Just needed to vent.

Then we went down south to Tønsberg where we spent most of our time at the beach, it was almost too hot. I hadn’t seen my niece and nephew for a year, and they’ve both grown so much, it was amazing to see them again.

I have to add that we had an absolutely wonderful time with my family in Norway until this happened. We went to see my grandparents in Trondheim for their combined 155th birthday, it was Robin’s first time in Trondheim and I hadn’t been there in 10 years.
Now to eat, maybe cry a bit more, and then sleep for about a week.

Robin was probably in even more pain than me, but he copes a bit better with 4 hours sleep than I do. The whole thing was an absolute farse. We were lucky to be surrounded by some incredibly understanding and helpful passengers in the same travel situation.

I legitimately can’t remember the last time I have been this exhausted and in as much pain, and that’s saying something. We were put up at a hotel last night, when we finally got there at 10.30 pm, 11 hours after we got to the airport, I just sat and cried for 10 minutes.

After having been subjected to what I have no qualms about describing as physical and emotional torture for approx 22 hours by Norwegian Airline, Robin and I are finally home. It is nothing short of miraculous that we made it.
